body: We're aware of the issue but weren't able reproduce it yet. Your screenshot is pretty interesting though, as half of the UI appears to work. This almost looks like some kind of race condition.

I can now add the following observation. After I was able to observe the error pattern on two hosts with syncthing increased from 1.25 to 1.26, I switched back to basic-auth as written and the error disappeared. Now I have switched two more hosts and the error didn't even occur on them in the same browser session with the new login mask, which surprised me. Then I switched the two first migrated hosts back to the new login mask as a cross-check, and lo and behold, the error disappeared, as if Chrome had to get used to it... If I can do anything to help find the cause, let me do so let me know.

issue.title: Unable to logout and excessive events after upgrading to 1.26.0

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: New issues needed to be validated

issue.body:
### Does your log mention database corruption?

No.

### Include required information

System: MacOS 14.0
Browser (tested at least): Firefox 119.0.1

When upgrading from either 1.23.7 or 1.25.0 to 1.26.0, I am not able to logout using the logout button and the API-calls tend to go haywire.

Steps to reproduce the issue (at least it seems to work here):
1.) Use an older version, go to firefox and log in.
2.) Upgrade Syncthing (in my case I restarted the binary, but now without the `--no-upgrade` call, and/or pressing the upgrade button in the GUI
3.) ...problems.
(I managed to get to this point now four times following the above steps)

What I expected: Properly logout and go to the (new) login page.
What happens: Nothing really, just a refresh of the page.

But more interestingly, when this happens, the API-calls become the following (I took one second out of it, but it just keeps going as this):

For the record, when this happens, the environment is quiet. No syncthing, other remote devices are offline and I don't do anything. So I don't expect much more events than a handful once every +- 10 seconds.

To get out of this loop, clearing the cookies followed by restarting the browser tends to work.

As a side-note, this came forward (in a spamming fashion) in the console:
```
Some cookies are misusing the recommended “SameSite“ attribute (1643)
```

```
Cookie “sessionid-ICLAR” does not have a proper “SameSite” attribute value. Soon, cookies without the “SameSite” attribute or with an invalid value will be treated as “Lax”. This means that the cookie will no longer be sent in third-party contexts. If your application depends on this cookie being available in such contexts, please add the “SameSite=None“ attribute to it. To know more about the “SameSite“ attribute, read https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Set-Cookie/SameSite
```

issue.title: Web interface not loading / cookie problem

There is the same issue.

issue.title: v1.26.0 GUI Loops Forever on Login

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: New issues needed to be validated

issue.body:
### Does your log mention database corruption?

No errors in log.

### Include required information

**which version of Syncthing and what operating system you are using**

v1.26.0, Linux (64-bit Intel/AMD Container)

**browser and version, if applicable**

Issue is present with Firefox 119.0 (64-bit) on macOS.

(Cannot be reproduced with Google Chrome Version 119.0.6045.123 (Official Build) (arm64))

 **what happened**

I was presented with the new form-based login screen. I logged in with my usual username and password. Instead of showing me the dashboard, the browser tab locks up with what looks like a redirect loop.

**what you expected to happen instead**

I expected to log in and be presented with the usual dashboard.

**any steps to reproduce the problem**

This issue only seems to affect v1.26.0 when using Firefox to access the GUI. **Also** this issue only seems to get triggered if I am accessing a remote Syncthing GUI using the IP address of the remote host. (This issue does not occur when loading the local GUI via `localhost`.)

**WORKAROUND**

I've gone into the settings and set `sendBasicAuthPrompt` which allows me to access the dashboard via Firefox.

body: I just experienced the same issue, and I fixed it by clearing cookies. It seems there were 2 cookies named `sessionid-xxxx`

Deleted cookies. The problem is not solved.
![image](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/assets/150396699/715aa9e2-ec72-41e9-913d-5360705b8582)

I see this too (Chrome 119.0.6045.105; syncthing 1.26 built from source using Go 1.20.5). Not tried clearing cookies yet, will do so. Backed down to 1.24, which fortunately worked fine. The only extension I'm using is uBlock Origin, which is not blocking anything on this page.

I use MS Edge, met this issue also.
And I found why: I use Nginx proxy manager, and enabled `cache asset`. After disable it, syncthing works well.

I had the "endless reload loop" here (Firefox 118.0.2) on multiple installations of 1.26. Clearing cookies has solved the problem.

These were the cookies before I did that:

| Name             | Path         | Expires | HttpOnly | Secure |
| ---------------- | ------------ | ------- | -------- | ------ |
| CSRF-Token-XXXXX | /            | Session | false    | false  |
| sessionid-XXXXX  | /            | Session | false    | true   |
| sessionid-XXXXX  | /rest        | Session | false    | true   |
| sessionid-XXXXX  | /rest/svc    | Session | false    | true   |
| sessionid-XXXXX  | /rest/system | Session | false    | true   |

After deleting the cookies and logging in again, only CSRF-Token-XXXXX and the sessionid-XXXXX for path "/" were recreated.
Had to revert to Basic Auth as well (Chrome here). Clearing cache and cookies did not help. It logged but the interface was broken. Could only login through an anonymous tab.

So, my interpretation of all this:

- Previously, we did not set `Path: /` on the cookie. Sometimes it ended up on that path, but we also sometimes polluted the cookie space with `/rest` etc cookies as seen above.
- Currently, we set the cookie on `/` but when *getting* the cookie we sometimes get a random cookie for another path that we didn't set. This is an auth failure so we loop.

We can solve this now by either looking at *all* cookies and verifying that we check the one for `/`, or we can use a new cookie name and the old ones should be irrelevant.
There's a separate issue that logging *out* will not work as expected if the browser has also cached basic-auth credentials, but that's less critical imho.

issue.title: v1.26.0 Form-login doesn't works for HTTP (no TLS)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: needs-triage
labels.description: New issues needed to be validated

issue.body:
### Does your log mention database corruption?

No.

### Include required information
#### Versions
 - Syncthing v1.26.0, Windows 10, amd64
 - Firefox 115.0
#### Recipe
 - Setup GUI with user/pass, with form-login and without HTTPS
 - Attempt to login
#### Expected result
Syncthing dashboard.
#### Actual result
Login form shows once again.
### Investigation
`/rest/noauth/auth/password` returns `Cookie: sessionid-XXX ... Secure`, which is incorrect for HTTP setup.
### Workaround
Reverting to HTTP-Basic authentication.

issue.title: Syncthing Tray stops updating (stalls) after resuming Windows from hibernation

repository.name: syncthingtray
repository.description: Tray application and Dolphin/Plasma integration for Syncthing

issue.body:
**Relevant components**
* [x] Standalone tray application (based on Qt Widgets)
* [ ] Plasmoid/applet for Plasma desktop
* [ ] Dolphin integration
* [ ] Command line tool (`syncthingctl`)
* [ ] Integrated Syncthing instance (`libsyncthing`)
* [ ] Backend libraries

**Environment and versions**
* Versions of `syncthingtray`, `qtutilities` and `c++utilities`: 1.4.7, …, …
* Qt version: 6.5.3
* C++ compiler (name and version): …
* C++ standard library (name and version): …
* Operating system (name and version): Windows 10 x64

**Bug description**

It seems that after hibernating the OS and then resuming from hibernation later, Syncthing Tray stalls and stops updating the Syncthing state. In other words, it appears stuck in the last state from before the OS was hibernated.

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Run Syncthing Tray connected to a Syncthing instance.
2. Hibernate Windows.
3. After a while, resume the OS from hibernation.

**Expected behavior**

Syncthing Tray should refresh the Syncthing state after resuming the OS from hibernation following the poll intervals set in the configuration.

**Screenshots**

![image](https://github.com/Martchus/syncthingtray/assets/5626656/51d01f09-b237-406b-8b0d-1f2a94d523ec)

**Additional context**

I have experienced the problem on two unrelated Windows devices.
